fields.name: relDocTypeCond
fields.description: This is the related Document Type for this Condition.

fields.name: recmReqActionForCond
fields.description: recommended Condition Request Message from DocType table

fields.name: finalReqActionForCond
fields.description:
This is the final Requested Action for this condition. 
1. For variable conditions like LoanStream: AI generates this and needs to be approved.
2. For predetermined conditions like Visio, the message is already templated and can't be personalized with amounts. Those variables amounts can be in the beginning part of the email as appropriate for the submitter to see.

fields.name: recmGuidelines
fields.description: recommended based on Lookup field from Doc Types table

fields.name: recmRequester
fields.description: c-Requester (CC:) (dT)

fields.name: recmSubmitter
fields.description: c-Submitter (TO:) (dT)

fields.name: aiCondCategory
fields.description: the category based on enum for condition category

fields.name: categoryName
fields.description: lookup field from Categories table

fields.name: recmRequestor
fields.description: This is the final selection for who is requesting this document. They will be included in the cc: section unless Make's Gmail account of processing@ can send as them in the FROM:

fields.name: recmReqNum
fields.description: Needed for drop-down in Click up

fields.name: Submitter
fields.description: Final selection for submitter of document which is the TO: address

fields.name: recmSub#
fields.description: Needed for drop-down in ClickUp

fields.name: catRequestor
fields.description: Recommended from Category but not final selected requester because there are exceptions at the document type level.

fields.name: catSubmitter
fields.description: Recommended based on Category

fields.name: aiMatchSummary
fields.description: keep this in JSON object so it can be retrieved. it holds no value separating out, can do that in Make.com

fields.name: allDocProperties
fields.description: keep this in JSON object so it can be retrieved. it holds no value separating out, can do that in Make.com

tables.name: Agreements
tables.description:
Agreements are any contract (e.g., projects, loans, rehab quotes, prop mgr statements, SOWs) between two or more parties. 

The party writing the agreement is the 'offerOR' and the parties receiving the agreement are the 'offerEEs'
